. It lays at the end of the Cannobina Valley on the West side of the lake. It's municipality (
in Italian) is next to the Swiss border.

The nearest airport is Milan Malpensa, about 1 hour and 30 minutes by car.
Bus services connect with Milan and local bus goes to Gallarate Station.

There is no train station at Cannobio, the closest are in
, Switzerland, and Verbania-Pallanza. It is possible to take the bus from these to Cannobio.

value: Locarno, connections with Bellinzona and the rest of Switzerland.
Verbania-Pallanza, connections with Milan, Italy, and Bern, Switzerland.

connects Cannobio to Brissago, Switzerland, Verbania and other towns in the region.

provides bus services from Locarno to Brissago at the Italian border.

From Locarno:

value: Take the bus to Brissago, where you'll be able to change to an Italian bus.
At the Verbania-Pallanza train station take the bus to Verbania-Intra on the Omegna-Verbania line.
In Verbania take the bus to Brissago (CH).

From Locarno: Take the 13 to the border, which becomes SS34 once in Italy.

From Milan (Highways/

value: Take the A8/E62 towards Gallarate, take the direction A26 Genova, Gravellona Toce.

Take the A26/E62, direction Gravellona Toce
Exit at Gravellona Toce and take the SS34 towards Verbania/Intra
After Verbania/Intra keep going on SS34 along the lake to Cannobio

Ferries on Lake Maggiore go to all major towns on the lake and some smaller ones.
